    • Constructor Detail

      • YamlConfig

        public YamlConfig(java.io.File pluginDataFolder,
                  java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        pluginDataFolder - The plugin's data directory, accessible with JavaPlugin#getDataFolder();
        name - The name of the config file excluding file extensions. Please notice that the constructor does not yet create the YAML-configuration file. To create the file on the disk, use createConfig().
        Since:
        1.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • createConfig

        public void createConfig()
        Since:
        1.0.0 This creates the configuration file. If the data folder is invalid, it will be created along with the config file.

      • getDirectory

        public java.io.File getDirectory()
        Returns:
        The configuration file's directory. To get its name, use getName() instead.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        The name of the configuration file, including file extensions. This returns the name of the configuration file with the .yml extension. To get the file's directory, use getDirectory().
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getFile

        public java.io.File getFile()
        Returns:
        The config file. This returns the actual File object of the config file.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getConfig

        public org.bukkit.configuration.file.FileConfiguration getConfig()
        Returns:
        The FileConfiguration object. This returns the actual FileConfiguration object of the config file.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • addDefault

        public void addDefault(java.lang.String key,
                       java.lang.String value)
        Parameters:
        key - The config key, including the path.
        value - the config value. Set a default configuration value: if the entered key already exists (and it holds another value), it will do nothing. If it doesn't, it will create the key with the wanted value.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • addDefaults

        public void addDefaults(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> defaults)
        Parameters:
        defaults - A map containing the default configuration keys and values. This sets the default configuration values as the ones contained in the map.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • save

        public void save()
        Since:
        1.0.0 This saves the configuration file. Saving is required every time you write to it.

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Since:
        1.0.0 This reloads the configuration file, making Java acknowledge and load the new config and its values.

      • deleteFile

        public void deleteFile()
        Since:
        1.0.0 This deletes the config file.

      • deleteParentDir

        public void deleteParentDir()
        Since:
        2.0.0 This deletes the config file's directory and all it's contents.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Since:
        1.0.0 This deletes and recreates the file, wiping all its contents.

      • wipeDirectory

        public void wipeDirectory()
        Since:
        1.0.0 Wipe the config file's directory, including the file itself.

      • createSubDirectory

        public void createSubDirectory(java.lang.String name)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        name - The sub directory's name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the entered string has a file extension or already exists. This will create a sub-directory in the plugin's data folder, which can be accessed with getDirectory(). If the entered name is not a valid name for a directory or the sub-directory already exists or the data folder does not exist, an IOException will be thrown.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String value)
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        true or false This returns true if the config contains the given value.
        Since:
        1.0.0
